alert.note: Alert for Camas; Elmore (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 7:40PM MDT until further notice by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Idaho, including the following counties, Camas and Elmore. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 740 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Camas Creek, Negro Creek, Lansing Creek, Chimney Creek, Threemile Creek, Cow Creek, Dairy Creek and East Fork Clover Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hill City and Davis Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
